enWisdom: Intelligence is closeness, foolishness is estrangement
Intelligence is a remedy
Intelligence improves deliberation
The intellect necessitates caution
The intellect is an intimate friend that is relied on in every situation
The intellect gives one a sense of familiarity when he is away from his homeland
Be rational and you will discern
The most felicitous of people is the intelligent one
The most felicitous of people is the intelligent one
The root of wisdom is reflection, and its fruit is wellbeing

Wisdom: أَدْرَكُ النَّاسِ لِحَاجَتِهِ ذُو الْعَقْلِ الْمُتَرَفِّقِ
enWisdom: The person who attains his objective the most is one who has intelligence and is mild-mannered

Wisdom: إِنَّ بِذَوِي الْعُقُولِ مِنَ الْحَاجَةِ إِلَى الْأَدَبِ كَمَا يَظْمَأُ الزَّرْعُ إِلَى الْمَطَرِ
enWisdom: The people of intellect are in need of good etiquette just as the plants thirst for rain
When the intellect is complete, speech decreases
It is through the intellect that the deepest wisdom is brought out
Through the intellect, [acts of goodness and] virtues are attained
Through abundant intellect, forbearance becomes abundant
Perfection of the soul is [attained] through the intellect
The fruit of intellect is steadfastness [and uprightness]
The fruit of intellect is adherence to the truth
The fruit of intellect is association with the virtuous
The fruit of intellect is working for salvation
The fruit of intellect is being affable with the people
The fruit of intellect is honesty

Wisdom: ثَمَرَةُ الْعَقْلِ مَقْتُ الدُّنْيَا وَقَمْعُ الْهَوَى
enWisdom: The fruit of intellect is aversion to this world and subdual of vain desire

Wisdom: حِفْظُ الْعَقْلِ بِمُخَالَفَةِ الْهَوَى وَالْعُزُوفِ عَنِ الدُّنْيَا
enWisdom: Preservation of the intellect is through opposing vain desire and turning away from this world
A heightened intellect saves [one from perdition]
The intrinsic nature of the intellect rejects dispraised action
The veil of flaws is the intellect
How many a lowly person has been made venerable by his intellect

Wisdom: كُلَّمَا ازْدَادَ عَقْلُ الرَّجُلِ قَوِيَ إِيمَانُهُ بِالْقَدَرِ وَاسْتَخَفَّ بِالْغِيَرِ
enWisdom: Whenever the intellect of a person increases, his faith in divine decree becomes stronger and he takes the changing events [that bring worldly loss to him] lightly

Wisdom: لِلْحَازِمِ مِنْ عَقْلِهِ عَنْ كُلِّ دَنِيَّةٍ [مِنْ كُلِّ دَنِيَّةٍ] زَاجِرٌ
enWisdom: The intellect of the judicious one acts as a deterrent from every demerit

Wisdom: لَنْ يَنْجَعَ الْأَدَبُ حَتَّى يُقَارِنَهُ الْعَقْلُ
enWisdom: Good etiquette will not be effective until it is accompanied with intellect

Wisdom: لَوْ عَقَلَ الْمَرْءُ عَقْلَهُ لَأَحْرَزَ سِرَّهُ عَمَّنْ أَفْشَاهُ إِلَيْهِ وَلَمْ يُطْلِعْ أَحَداً عَلَيْهِ
enWisdom: If a person were to use his intellect, he would protect his secret from the one who has revealed [another’s secret] to him and would not inform anyone of it
One who has intelligence remains chaste [and abstains from the forbidden]
One who has intelligence seeks pardon [for the wrong he does]
Whoever seeks assistance from the intellect, it shows him the right direction

Wisdom: مَنْ قَدَّمَ عَقْلَهُ عَلَى هَوَاهُ حَسُنَتْ مَسَاعِيهِ
enWisdom: One who puts his intellect before his vain desire, his undertakings become good
There is no intelligence like feigning ignorance [when in the company of those who lack etiquette]
There is none more courageous than the intelligent one

Wisdom: لَا يَحْلُمُ عَنِ السَّفِيهِ إِلَّا الْعَاقِلُ
enWisdom: No one shows forbearance towards the foolish except the intelligent

Wisdom: لَا يَزْكُو عِنْدَ اللَّهِ سُبْحَانَهُ إِلَّا عَقْلٌ عَارِفٌ وَنَفْسٌ عَزُوفٌ
enWisdom: Nothing is purified in the sight of Allah, the Glorified, except the cognizant mind and the disinclined soul [from the pleasures of this world]

Wisdom: لِلْقُلُوبِ خَوَاطِرُ سُوءٍ وَالْعُقُولُ تَزْجُرُ عَنْهَا
enWisdom: There are some evil thoughts that come into the hearts, but the intellects deter one from [acting upon] them
